intro: Litobrochia microdictyon, commonly known as the small-spined stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant features fleshy, often hairy leaves that store water, adapting it to its harsh environment. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white, typically during the spring or early summer. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
